sad.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: not happy, especially because something unpleasant has happened
sad.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Dad looked sad and worried as he read the letter.
I was very sad to hear that he had died.
be sad to hear/see/read etc something
There was such a sad look in her eyes.
Lilly felt sad that Christmas was over.
I was sad about the friends I was leaving behind.
sad.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a sad event, situation etc makes you feel unhappy
sad.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Sorry to hear the sad news.
It was a sad case. The boy ended up in prison.
a story with a sad ending
It was sad to see them arguing.
it is sad to see/hear etc something
This is a sad day for us all.
sad.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: There aren’t enough teachers, which is a sad state of affairs (=bad situation).
Sad to say (=unfortunately), the country is heading towards civil war.
It’s sad if people are too afraid to go out alone at night.
The sad fact is that prejudice still exists.
sad.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a sad person has a dull, unhappy, or lonely life
sad.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: She’s a sad character – without any friends at all.
sad.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: boring or not deserving any respect
sad.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Stay in on Saturday night? What a sad idea!
sad.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: a sad event, situation etc makes you feel unhappy
sad.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: He had listened patiently to his client’s sad story about her awful life.
It was with great shock that we heard the sad news that he had died.
It’s a sad fact that a significant amount of crime is committed by young people.
The sad truth is that the new law will not deter criminals.
I’m really disappointed that this happened. It’s a sad day for football.
Take the sad case of Gary Marsh, who was badly injured during a match.
The film has a sad ending.
The sad thing is that there’s little we can do about the situation now.
sad.translation[0].note_box[1].sections[: sad
not happy
She felt sad as she waved goodbye.
a sad and lonely figure
a sad face
a sad film
unhappy
sad, especially for a long time – used about people and periods of time
I was unhappy at school.
an unhappy childhood
He’s obviously a deeply unhappy person.
homesick
sad because you are away from your home, family, and friends
She sometimes felt homesick when she first arrived in Japan.
feeling sad for a few hours or days, often for no reason
Whenever I’m feeling down, I go out and buy myself some new clothes.
She’s been kind of down since that argument with Jack.
gloomy
looking or sounding sad and without hope – used about people, places, and weather
Why are you all looking so gloomy?
the gloomy immigration office
a gloomy afternoon in February
dejected/downcast
looking sad and disappointed because something you hoped for did not happen
‘I didn’t pass, ’ he said, looking dejected.
a downcast expression
He was understandably downcast after the team’s loss.
mournful
looking or sounding sad
the dog’s big mournful eyes
the mournful sound of the church bell
a mournful expression
glum
looking sad and disappointed
Don’t look so glum! Maybe you’ll win next time.
They sat in glum silence.
wistful
looking a little sad and thoughtful, because you wish that the situation was different
She looked at him with a wistful smile.
very sad
miserable
very sad, especially because you are lonely, cold, ill, or upset – used about people and periods of time
I felt miserable and blamed myself for what had happened.
Her life was miserable.
I had a miserable time at college.
depressed
very sad and without hope for a long time, because things are wrong in your life or because of a medical condition
After his wife left him, he became depressed and refused to talk to anyone.
heartbroken
extremely sad because of something that has happened to someone or something that you care about very much
She was heartbroken when her dog died.
distressed/distraught
very upset because of something bad that has happened, so that you cannot think clearly
She was very distressed when he left her.
The boy’s hospital bed was surrounded by distraught relatives.
devastated
extremely sad and shocked, because something very bad has happened
The whole town was devastated by the tragedy.
